intro: Bucephalophora aculeata subsp. aegaea, commonly known as the Aegean aculeate bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, often in mountainous areas. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a waxy coating. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
